sentences.sContent: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.sCn: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

sentences.sContent: All the exam results will be displayed on the noticeboard.
sentences.sCn: 所有的考试成绩将在布告板上公布。

sentences.sContent: ten piano pieces, each written to display the talents of individual players
sentences.sCn: 十首钢琴曲，每一首都为了展示演奏者的才华而作

sentences.sContent: ...we kept the job resources display up for months...
...we put up a display with a variety of job resources that we restocked every hour...
...Several of the employees in the computer department claim to be developing vision problems from having to stare at a video display terminal for about 7 hours a day...
...how to display them and so on...

phrases.pCn: n. 液晶显示器；液晶屏幕
abbr. 发光二极管显示器（light-emitting diode display）
直观显示；视觉显示；光学显示；可见显示
n. 视频显示；视频显示器

remMethod.val: dis(分开) ＋ play(播放， 表演) → 分列展示 → 陈列， 展览

trans.tranOther: to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily
